meanings.definition: The state or quality of being easily offended or upset.
meanings.sent1: Her touchinesses often lead to misunderstandings with her friends.
meanings.sent2: His touchinesses make it challenging to have open conversations with him.
meanings.sent3: Despite his touchinesses, he always tries to see the best in people.
meanings.sent4: The touchinesses of the cat were evident when it hissed at the slightest movement.
meanings.sent5: The touchinesses of the situation made it difficult to resolve peacefully.

meanings.definition: The tendency to react strongly or defensively to criticism or perceived slights.
meanings.sent1: The touchinesses of the employee were evident when he took offense at constructive feedback.
meanings.sent2: Dealing with his touchinesses requires a delicate approach to avoid unnecessary conflicts.
meanings.sent3: His touchinesses about his cooking skills led to a funny incident at the family dinner.
meanings.sent4: The touchinesses of the situation were like a shield, protecting him from any form of criticism.
meanings.sent5: The touchinesses of the team leader created a tense atmosphere during the meeting.
